I came here looking for tips on how to leverage my natural talents even more effectively, not to be torn down by someone who obviously doesn't understand confident, successful people.

I've been popular my whole life - in high school I was voted "Most Likely to Be Famous" and "Class Clown." In college, professors always remembered me because I wasn't afraid to speak up and contribute to discussions. At every job I've had, I've been the person people come to when they want things to be more interesting and dynamic.

Just last month at my cousin's wedding, I gave an impromptu speech during the reception because the best man's speech was kind of boring and people were losing interest. Everyone was talking about it afterward! The bride even came up to me with tears in her eyes - clearly moved by how I saved the moment.

I think what's happening here is that you're probably more of an introverted, behind-the-scenes type person, so you don't understand what it's like to be a natural leader and entertainer. That's fine - not everyone can be the center of attention. But don't project your own social limitations onto me.

I'm going to find someone who actually understands social dynamics and can help me channel my gifts more strategically. Thanks for nothing.

<END>
